title: How to Replace the Cutter Blade in a Foodsaver Machine

steps.title: Open the cover and locate the blade assembly from underneath.
steps.content: Open the cover and locate the blade assembly from underneath.

steps.title: Insert a small screwdriver or dull table knife under the retaining tab of the blade holder while gently pulling on the blade cartridge.
steps.content: Insert a small screwdriver or dull table knife under the retaining tab of the blade holder while gently pulling on the blade cartridge.

steps.title: Be careful not to loose the small spring on the blade assembly.
steps.content: Be careful not to loose the small spring on the blade assembly. These pictures show the retaining tab and the notch on the blade cartridge that it snaps over.

steps.title: Find the similar retaining tab on the blade cartridge.
steps.content: Find the similar retaining tab on the blade cartridge.

steps.title: Insert a small screwdriver or ice pick into the cartridge to unlock the tab while pulling on the blade carrier.
steps.content: Insert a small screwdriver or ice pick into the cartridge to unlock the tab while pulling on the blade carrier.

steps.title: Gently pull the blades out of the carrier.
steps.content: Gently pull the blades out of the carrier. Notice that they probably got dull simply by rusting. The replacement blades are Stanley Quickpoint 9mm blades, available as refills at your nearby home improvement store. These are the kind of blades that you break off when they get dull, to create a fresh edge (notice the score lines on the blades).Ace hardware brand in the small size works also.Probably any brand small (9mm) will work.

steps.title: OLFA 9281 AB-10S 9mm Stainless Steel Snap-Off Blades are available from Amazon.
steps.content: OLFA 9281 AB-10S 9mm Stainless Steel Snap-Off Blades are available from Amazon. They will prevent the "rusting" problem from happening again.

steps.title: Use two pairs of pliers to snap the blades.
steps.content: Use two pairs of pliers to snap the blades. Be careful not to touch the sharp blade edge with anything, they dull very easily.

steps.title: Hold the blade with the score line facing up, one plier on each side of the score line.
steps.content: Hold the blade with the score line facing up, one plier on each side of the score line. Notice that it takes 2 segments of the blade for each side of the Foodsaver cutter.

steps.title: Gently bend both sides down and the blade will break along the score line.
steps.content: Gently bend both sides down and the blade will break along the score line. If it doesn't break easily the you need to bend it the other direction.

steps.title: Break off 2 sets, each set being 2 segments wide.
steps.content: Break off 2 sets, each set being 2 segments wide.

steps.title: Carefully slide one set of blades into each side of the carrier.
steps.content: Carefully slide one set of blades into each side of the carrier.

steps.title: Looking down onto the top end of the carrier, the backs of each set should be touching the center of the carrier.
steps.content: Looking down onto the top end of the carrier, the backs of each set should be touching the center of the carrier.

steps.title: Insert the carrier back into the cartridge until it snaps into place.
steps.content: Insert the carrier back into the cartridge until it snaps into place. Be VERY careful not to cut yourself.

steps.title: Insert the cartridge back into the blade assembly, making sure the notch on the cartridge snaps into the tab on the blade assembly.
steps.content: Insert the cartridge back into the blade assembly, making sure the notch on the cartridge snaps into the tab on the blade assembly. That's all there is to it. It takes longer to explain than to actually replace the blades, it is easier than it sounds.
